title.rendered: Durham University Student Jailed After Grey College Burglaries

content.rendered:
Juan Martinez, a Postgraduate student at Grey College, has been imprisoned for 18 months after ransacking rooms over the Christmas holidays.

Martinez, originally from Mexico, broke into a room where he stole two laptops, electrical items, jewellery and other personal items. He also stole 46 letters from the college post room.

Martinez was eventually caught in a female toilet block in the college on the 5th of January. However, this did little to deter him as he returned on 21st of January to steal a door lock and “numerous letters”.

He then returned on January 23rd to burgle the college again, armed with a knife.

On the 7th of July he was sentenced to 18 months in prison for three counts of burglary and one count of going equipped to burgle.

Honorary Recorder of Durham James Adkin stated: “I have heard that you are a man of good character and appear to be intelligent and graduated from Durham University.

I am not entirely sure what motivated you to commit these offences. Only a custodial sentence can be justified.”
